hypothesis_content.title: Post-Liquidity-Crash Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following October's liquidity crash, BTC 20-day realized volatility has compressed to 35% (below 6-month average of 52%). A breakout above $89,500 will trigger volatility expansion where 5-day forward volatility exceeds 20-day backward volatility by >15%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Severe liquidity events create prolonged volatility compression. Breakouts from these compressions tend to be sustained as trapped liquidity re-enters. Current neutral regime with 61.5% confidence suggests balanced orderbook ripe for directional move.
entry_conditions: BTC daily close above $89,500 (resistance from pre-crash levels)
BTC funding rates turn positive (<0.01%) after being neutral/negative

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC drops back below $86,000 (below current consolidation)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout above $89,500 fails to sustain for 2 consecutive closes AND volatility remains compressed (<10% expansion).
